00117 static int getBaudDiv(const spi_options_t *options, unsigned int pba_hz)
00118 {
00119   int baudDiv = 0;
00120 
00121   if (!options->fdiv) {
00122     baudDiv = pba_hz / (options->baudrate);
00123   } else {
00124     baudDiv = pba_hz / (32 * options->baudrate);
00125   }
00126 
00127   if (baudDiv <= 0 || baudDiv > 255) {
00128     return -SPI_ERROR_ARGUMENT;
00129   }
00130 
00131   return baudDiv;
00132 }
00133 
00134 
00135 void spi_reset(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi)
00136 {
00137   spi->cr = AVR32_SPI_CR_SWRST_MASK;
00138 }
00139 
00140 
00141 int spi_initSlave(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi,
00142                   unsigned char bits,
00143                   unsigned char spi_mode)
00144 {
00145   if (spi_mode > 3 ||
00146       bits < 8 || bits > 16) {
00147     return SPI_ERROR_ARGUMENT;
00148   }
00149 
00150   // Reset.
00151   spi->cr = AVR32_SPI_CR_SWRST_MASK;
00152 
00153   // Will use CSR0 offsets; these are the same for CSR0 to CSR3.
00154   spi->csr0 = ((spi_mode >> 1) << AVR32_SPI_CSR0_CPOL_OFFSET) |
00155               (((spi_mode & 0x1) ^ 0x1) << AVR32_SPI_CSR0_NCPHA_OFFSET) |
00156               ((bits - 8) << AVR32_SPI_CSR0_BITS_OFFSET);
00157 
00158   return SPI_OK;
00159 }
00160 
00161 
00162 int spi_initTest(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi)
00163 {
00164   // Reset.
00165   spi->cr = AVR32_SPI_CR_SWRST_MASK;
00166   spi->mr |= AVR32_SPI_MR_MSTR_MASK | // Master Mode.
00167              AVR32_SPI_MR_LLB_MASK;   // Local Loopback.
00168 
00169   return SPI_OK;
00170 }
00171 
00172 
00173 int spi_initMaster(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi, const spi_options_t *options)
00174 {
00175   u_avr32_spi_mr_t u_avr32_spi_mr;
00176 
00177   if (options->fdiv > 1 ||
00178       options->modfdis > 1) {
00179     return SPI_ERROR_ARGUMENT;
00180   }
00181 
00182   // Reset.
00183   spi->cr = AVR32_SPI_CR_SWRST_MASK;
00184 
00185   // Master Mode.
00186   u_avr32_spi_mr.mr = spi->mr;
00187   u_avr32_spi_mr.MR.mstr = 1;
00188   u_avr32_spi_mr.MR.fdiv = options->fdiv;
00189   u_avr32_spi_mr.MR.modfdis = options->modfdis;
00190   u_avr32_spi_mr.MR.llb = 0;
00191   u_avr32_spi_mr.MR.pcs = (1 << AVR32_SPI_MR_PCS_SIZE) - 1;
00192   spi->mr = u_avr32_spi_mr.mr;
00193 
00194   return SPI_OK;
00195 }

00197 
00198 int spi_selectionMode(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi,
00199                       unsigned char variable_ps,
00200                       unsigned char pcs_decode,
00201                       unsigned char delay)
00202 {
00203   u_avr32_spi_mr_t u_avr32_spi_mr;
00204 
00205   if (variable_ps > 1 ||
00206       pcs_decode > 1) {
00207     return SPI_ERROR_ARGUMENT;
00208   }
00209 
00210   u_avr32_spi_mr.mr = spi->mr;
00211   u_avr32_spi_mr.MR.ps = variable_ps;
00212   u_avr32_spi_mr.MR.pcsdec = pcs_decode;
00213   u_avr32_spi_mr.MR.dlybcs = delay;
00214   spi->mr = u_avr32_spi_mr.mr;
00215 
00216   return SPI_OK;
00217 }

00219 
00220 int spi_selectChip(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi, unsigned char chip)
00221 {
00222 #ifdef FREERTOS_USED
00223   while (pdFALSE == xSemaphoreTake(xSPIMutex, 20));
00224 #endif
00225 
00226   // Assert all lines; no peripheral is selected.
00227   spi->mr |= AVR32_SPI_MR_PCS_MASK;
00228 
00229   if (spi->mr & AVR32_SPI_MR_PCSDEC_MASK) {
00230     // The signal is decoded; allow up to 15 chips.
00231     if (chip > 14) {
00232       return SPI_ERROR_ARGUMENT;
00233     }
00234 
00235     spi->mr &= ~AVR32_SPI_MR_PCS_MASK | (chip << AVR32_SPI_MR_PCS_OFFSET);
00236   } else {
00237     if (chip > 3) {
00238       return SPI_ERROR_ARGUMENT;
00239     }
00240 
00241     spi->mr &= ~(1 << (AVR32_SPI_MR_PCS_OFFSET + chip));
00242   }
00243 
00244   return SPI_OK;
00245 }
00246 
00247 
00248 int spi_unselectChip(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi, unsigned char chip)
00249 {
00250   // Assert all lines; no peripheral is selected.
00251   spi->mr |= AVR32_SPI_MR_PCS_MASK;
00252 
00253   // Last transfer, so deassert the current NPCS if CSAAT is set.
00254   spi->cr = AVR32_SPI_CR_LASTXFER_MASK;
00255 
00256 #ifdef FREERTOS_USED
00257   xSemaphoreGive(xSPIMutex);
00258 #endif
00259 
00260   return SPI_OK;
00261 }
00262 
00263 
00264 int spi_setupChipReg(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi,
00265                      const spi_options_t *options,
00266                      unsigned int pba_hz)
00267 {
00268   u_avr32_spi_csr_t u_avr32_spi_csr;
00269 
00270   if (options->spi_mode > 3 ||
00271       options->stay_act > 1 ||
00272       options->bits < 8 || options->bits > 16) {
00273     return SPI_ERROR_ARGUMENT;
00274   }
00275 
00276   int baudDiv = getBaudDiv(options, pba_hz);
00277 
00278   if (baudDiv < 0) {
00279     return -baudDiv;
00280   }
00281 
00282   // Will use CSR0 offsets; these are the same for CSR0 to CSR3.
00283   u_avr32_spi_csr.csr = 0;
00284   u_avr32_spi_csr.CSR.cpol = (unsigned int)options->spi_mode >> 1;
00285   u_avr32_spi_csr.CSR.ncpha = (options->spi_mode & 0x1) ^ 0x1;
00286   u_avr32_spi_csr.CSR.csaat = options->stay_act;
00287   u_avr32_spi_csr.CSR.bits = options->bits - 8;
00288   u_avr32_spi_csr.CSR.scbr = baudDiv;
00289   u_avr32_spi_csr.CSR.dlybs = options->spck_delay;
00290   u_avr32_spi_csr.CSR.dlybct = options->trans_delay;
00291 
00292   switch(options->reg) {
00293     case 0:
00294       spi->csr0 = u_avr32_spi_csr.csr;
00295       break;
00296     case 1:
00297       spi->csr1 = u_avr32_spi_csr.csr;
00298       break;
00299     case 2:
00300       spi->csr2 = u_avr32_spi_csr.csr;
00301       break;
00302     case 3:
00303       spi->csr3 = u_avr32_spi_csr.csr;
00304       break;
00305     default:
00306       return SPI_ERROR_ARGUMENT;
00307   }
00308 
00309 #ifdef FREERTOS_USED
00310   if (!xSPIMutex)
00311   {
00312     // Create the SPI mutex.
00313     vSemaphoreCreateBinary(xSPIMutex);
00314     if (!xSPIMutex)
00315     {
00316       while(1);
00317     }
00318   }
00319 #endif
00320 
00321   return SPI_OK;
00322 }

00325 void spi_enable(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi)
00326 {
00327   spi->cr = AVR32_SPI_CR_SPIEN_MASK;
00328 }
00329 
00330 
00331 void spi_disable(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi)
00332 {
00333   spi->cr = AVR32_SPI_CR_SPIDIS_MASK;
00334 }

00337 unsigned char spi_writeRegisterEmptyCheck(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi)
00338 {
00339   return ((spi->sr & AVR32_SPI_SR_TDRE_MASK) != 0);
00340 }
00341 
00342 
00343 int spi_write(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi, unsigned short data)
00344 {
00345   unsigned int timeout = SPI_TIMEOUT;
00346 
00347   while (!(spi->sr & AVR32_SPI_SR_TDRE_MASK)) {
00348     if (!timeout--) {
00349       return SPI_ERROR_TIMEOUT;
00350     }
00351   }
00352 
00353   spi->tdr = data << AVR32_SPI_TDR_TD_OFFSET;
00354 
00355   return SPI_OK;
00356 }
00357 
00358 
00359 int spi_variableSlaveWrite(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi, unsigned short data,
00360                            unsigned char pcs, unsigned char lastxfer)
00361 {
00362   unsigned int timeout = SPI_TIMEOUT;
00363 
00364   if (pcs > 14 || lastxfer > 1) {
00365     return SPI_ERROR_ARGUMENT;
00366   }
00367 
00368   while (!(spi->sr & AVR32_SPI_SR_TDRE_MASK)) {
00369     if (!timeout--) {
00370       return SPI_ERROR_TIMEOUT;
00371     }
00372   }
00373 
00374   spi->tdr = (data << AVR32_SPI_TDR_TD_OFFSET) |
00375              (pcs << AVR32_SPI_TDR_PCS_OFFSET) |
00376              (lastxfer << AVR32_SPI_TDR_LASTXFER_OFFSET);
00377 
00378   return SPI_OK;
00379 }
00380 
00381 
00382 unsigned char spi_writeEndCheck(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi)
00383 {
00384   return ((spi->sr & AVR32_SPI_SR_TXEMPTY_MASK) != 0);
00385 }
00386 
00387 
00388 unsigned char spi_readRegisterFullCheck(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi)
00389 {
00390   return ((spi->sr & AVR32_SPI_SR_RDRF_MASK) != 0);
00391 }
00392 
00393 
00394 int spi_read(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi, unsigned short *data)
00395 {
00396   unsigned int timeout = SPI_TIMEOUT;
00397 
00398   while ((spi->sr & (AVR32_SPI_SR_RDRF_MASK | AVR32_SPI_SR_TXEMPTY_MASK)) !=
00399          (AVR32_SPI_SR_RDRF_MASK | AVR32_SPI_SR_TXEMPTY_MASK)) {
00400     if (!timeout--) {
00401       return SPI_ERROR_TIMEOUT;
00402     }
00403   }
00404 
00405   *data = spi->rdr >> AVR32_SPI_RDR_RD_OFFSET;
00406 
00407   return SPI_OK;
00408 }
00409 
00410 
00411 unsigned char spi_getStatus(volatile avr32_spi_t *spi)
00412 {
00413   unsigned char ret = 0;
00414   unsigned long sr = spi->sr;
00415 
00416   if (!(sr & AVR32_SPI_SR_OVRES_MASK)) {
00417     ret = SPI_ERROR_OVERRUN;
00418   }
00419 
00420   if (!(sr & AVR32_SPI_SR_MODF_MASK)) {
00421     ret += SPI_ERROR_MODE_FAULT;
00422   }
00423 
00424   if (ret == (SPI_ERROR_OVERRUN + SPI_ERROR_MODE_FAULT)) {
00425     return SPI_ERROR_OVERRUN_AND_MODE_FAULT;
00426   }
00427   else if (ret > 0) {
00428     return ret;
00429   } else {
00430     return SPI_OK;
00431   }
00432 }
